messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: Could you improve this comment a bit.  Which headers?  Why are they special?

messages.author: darin
messages.text: it is a little strange to mention things like IPC here in the HttpCache code.  that implies knowledge of chrome internals, which this layer knows nothing of otherwise.  is there a better way to describe what this alternative mode is doing?

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text:
As Darin pointed out, it's definitely important to keep these components conceptually isolated, so FOR_IPC doesn't make sense here.

Maybe a better name would just be to make it explicit as to what it's doing.  PERSIST_WITHOUT_COOKIE_HEADERS ?  I'm not familiar with the code that much, I'm guessing _RAW is everything, _CACHE has some things filtered, is your _IPC the same filtering as _CACHE plus cookies?  Maybe that should be denoted some how, like FOR_CACHE_WITHOUT_COOKIES.  Dunno.

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: On second reading, this name is really strange.  Do you mean GetHeadersThatAreUnsafeForIPC?

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: Maybe say why, that we want to filter http only cookies, but instead we're just filtering all cookies, because we don't want to leak this knowledge into the renderer.

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: I think a switch for 2 cases is overkill.

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: I saw this code before and thought it was a little bit sketchy.  Might just want to improve the comment, noting that raw_headers_ has embedded nulls, and we want the substring before the first null.  I realize this isn't your code.

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text:
// We write comments like this.

Realize it isn't your code, but might as well clean it up.

messages.author: Dean McNamee
messages.text: I guess now this should be GetCookieHeaders, and this should be PERSIST_WITHOUT_COOKIES or something.
